intro: Linaria dolichoceras, commonly known as the long-beaked toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the genus Linaria in the family Plantaginaceae, characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that resemble those of snapdragons. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive elongated spur at the base of each petal. Linaria dolichoceras is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively low maintenance.
